pullRequest.body:
We say a morphism of schemes is smooth (of relative dimension `n`) if for every point of the source there exist affine open neighborhoods of the point and its image such that the induced ring map is standard smooth (of relative dimension `n`). These notions are local on the source and the target and satisfy the standard stability properties.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #16868
- [x] depends on: #17305 
- [x] depends on: #17335

### PR summary [609cedbfec](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14161/commits/609cedbfec15cd3d6dec8eb856963f441c1285a3)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Smooth`|1718|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsSmooth`
`+ IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension`
`+ IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension.isSmooth`
`+ exists_affineOpens_le_appLE_of_appLE`
`+ exists_basicOpen_le_appLE_of_appLE_of_isAffine`
`+ instance (priority := 900) [IsOpenImmersion f] : IsSmooth f`
`+ instance (priority := 900) [IsOpenImmersion f] : IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension 0 f`
`+ instance : HasRingHomProperty (@IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension n)`
`+ instance : HasRingHomProperty @IsSmooth (Locally IsStandardSmooth.{0, 0}) := by`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsStableUnderComposition (@IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension 0)`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsStableUnderComposition @IsSmooth`
`+ instance {Z : Scheme.{u}} (g : Y ⟶ Z) [IsSmoothOfRelativeDimension 0 f]`
`+ isSmoothOfRelativeDimension_comp`
`+ isSmoothOfRelativeDimension_stableUnderBaseChange`
`+ isSmooth_comp`
`+ isSmooth_stableUnderBaseChange`
`+ locally_of_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@chrisflav . It seems that you are planning to split this up into multiple PRs. What is the status of that? It would be great to get this work moving along!

> @chrisflav . It seems that you are planning to split this up into multiple PRs. What is the status of that? It would be great to get this work moving along!

Sorry, I was pushing on other fronts lately and did not have time to come to the review party. The first two PRs in this series are merged:
- #14271 
- #14325 
And I'll continue this series after my summer vacation.
Enjoy your vacation! I'm labelling this as awaiting-author then.

I just opened another batch of PRs on standard smooth algebras:
- #16727
- #16869
- #16853
- #16827
- #16868

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16868~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17305~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17335~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by jcommelin.

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for all the reviews!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382378777/job/31665734010)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382378777/job/31665734618)

```suggestion
structure Algebra.Presentation extends (P : Algebra.Generators.{w} R S) where
  /-- The type of relations.  -/
  relations : Type t
  /-- The assignment of each relation to a polynomial in the generators. -/
  relation : relations → P.Ring
```
That syntax does not seem to work? It gives "unkown identifier `P`"
I think you should just say that `relation` spans the kernel ideal.
I don't think we need this, and we should just define `P.Ideal := RingHom.ker (eval P.val)`
I think we should have the equivalence, but I refactored it so its better now.
Yes, and I had already done this in some other PR :D I had messed up the merging. Is now fixed.

```suggestion
open neighborhoods of `x` (resp. `f.base x`), then `P` also holds for `f` over some affine open
```
I guess you can use only one line here. (Not very important of course.)
Out of scope of this PR but do we know that standard smooth morphisms are finitely presented, and that `IsStandardSmooth.{u, v} <-> IsStandardSmooth.{0, 0}`?

Not directly, but we have [Algebra.Presentation.finitePresentation_of_isFinite](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Presentation.html#Algebra.Presentation.finitePresentation_of_isFinite). I'll add the implication in a followup PR. For the equivalence with universes, no, but it's on my todo list.
Or maybe we should just drop the universe argument from `IsStandardSmooth` completely and define a constructor that takes arbitrary universe presentation instead.
Gives less nice def-eqs though if you are working with explicit presentations of algebras.
Ah sorry, I was confused and thought you were talking about `Presentation`. I agree, dropping universe parameters from `IsStandardSmooth` is fine.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): smooth morphisms of schemes
